title: Adding new files into Merac Updater
text: It's possible to add in additional files such as the Line Display video file The files are stored within the below table: Select * from MstorePublishedFiles Can manually insert new files such as below: insert into MstorePublishedFiles values ('cache','LineDisplay.wmv','X',GETDATE(),null,'C:\Meracdata\updatenewver\cache\LineDisplay.wmv',null) Ensure the file you require is in the updatenewver location specified: C:\Meracdata\updatenewver\cache\LineDisplay.wmv Re-update the MStore files and ensure it updates:

title: What MStore Version is a customer on
text: The version which each MStore instance is on is stored against the relevant customer contract in Freshdesk. You can see a full list on this report Contracts with Software Versions. After every upgrade, the version on the Contract should be updated by the person doing the upgrade. Every time an upgrade is performed at a site, it writes to the DBHistory and DBUpdateLog tables within the customers database. If you want to be sure of the version (in case the Contract in Freshdesk hasn't been updated), then look in this table or jump onto their server and open the Back Office, which will say the version on the login screen.

title: Error on Windows 11 after removing Opos and installing WINRECEIPT
text: The following error was experienced on Windows 11. The customer wanted to change the printer from Opos to Windows (WINRECEIPT). Windows printer driver would not install until Opos had been completely removed from the till. Despite a successful install and test print of WINRECEIPT when starting POS the following error was experienced. Uninstalling and reinstalling Mstore on the till resolved the issue.

title: Recovering a missing drawer
text: Sometimes, a till will lose a drawer and prevent the customer from opening a new drawer with the same number. A warning message will indicate that the drawer number is already in use. To resolve this issue, follow these simple steps: Navigate to the TILLTXNS file on the affected till or PC. Locate the TXN file for the drawer within this folder and open the NewTXNs file. In the NewTXNs file, check for the drawer number, which should be listed in the format "Drawer=001|1". If it is not present, add it manually. Save and close the file. Close the POS system currently in use and then reopen it. After reopening, the drawer should reappear in the drawer bar section. Typically, the customer will have already opened a new drawer. In this case, close the old drawer and inform the customer that the drawer number can be used again the following day.
description:
Sometimes, a till will lose a drawer and prevent the customer from opening a new drawer with the same number. A warning message will indicate that the drawer number is already in use.

To resolve this issue, follow these simple steps:

  1. Navigate to the TILLTXNS file on the affected till or PC.
  2. Locate the TXN file for the drawer within this folder and open the NewTXNs file.
  3. In the NewTXNs file, check for the drawer number, which should be listed in the format "Drawer=001|1". If it is not present, add it manually.
  4. Save and close the file.
  5. Close the POS system currently in use and then reopen it.
  6. After reopening, the drawer should reappear in the drawer bar section.

Typically, the customer will have already opened a new drawer. In this case, close the old drawer and inform the customer that the drawer number can be used again the following day.

title: Reinstalling Printer driver
text: The main printer used for tills is the WINRECEIPT printer. Occasionally, it may encounter connection issues with the till and require reinstallation. This process is generally quick and straightforward. Open Printers and Devices and rename the existing WINRECEIPT printer. Simply add a number or another identifier to the current name. Navigate to C:\THERMAL Receipt Printer 4.X and install the driver. During the installation, you will be prompted to name the printer. Ensure that it is named WINRECEIPT for proper functionality. Once the installation is complete, run the POS system. The connection issues should be resolved, and no errors should appear. If the problem persists, you may need to contact second-line support for further assistance.
description:

  2. Navigate to C:\THERMAL Receipt Printer 4.X and install the driver.
  4. During the installation, you will be prompted to name the printer. Ensure that it is named WINRECEIPT for proper functionality.

title: Script to Search All SQL Tables for a Keyword
text: Searches all character-based columns across all tables and views for a specific keyword. ---------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------- Define the search term-------------------------- DECLARE @searchTerm NVARCHAR(100) = 'Gift Aid'; --This is the only part of the script you need to change. ---------------------------------------------------------------------- --Searches all text-based columns in all tables/views for a keyword --Skips invalid or inaccessible objects --Shows matching table name, column name, and data ---------------------------------------------------------------------- DECLARE @schema NVARCHAR(128); DECLARE @table NVARCHAR(128); DECLARE @column NVARCHAR(128); DECLARE @fullTable NVARCHAR(256); DECLARE @sql NVARCHAR(MAX); -- Cursor for text-based columns DECLARE column_cursor CURSOR FOR SELECT TABLE_SCHEMA, TABLE_NAME, COLUMN_NAME FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS WHERE DATA_TYPE IN ('varchar', 'nvarchar', 'char', 'nchar', 'text', 'ntext'); OPEN column_cursor; FETCH NEXT FROM column_cursor INTO @schema, @table, @column; WHILE @@FETCH_STATUS = 0 BEGIN SET @fullTable = QUOTENAME(@schema) + '.' + QUOTENAME(@table); -- Only proceed if the table exists IF EXISTS ( SELECT 1 FROM sys.objects o JOIN sys.schemas s ON o.schema_id = s.schema_id WHERE o.name = @table AND s.name = @schema AND o.type IN ('U', 'V') -- U = table, V = view ) BEGIN SET @sql = ' BEGIN TRY IF EXISTS ( SELECT 1 FROM ' + @fullTable + ' WHERE ' + QUOTENAME(@column) + ' LIKE ''%' + @searchTerm + '%'' ) BEGIN PRINT ''Match in ' + @fullTable + '.' + @column + '''; SELECT ''' + @fullTable + ''' AS TableName, ''' + @column + ''' AS ColumnName, * FROM ' + @fullTable + ' WHERE ' + QUOTENAME(@column) + ' LIKE ''%' + @searchTerm + '%''; END END TRY BEGIN CATCH PRINT ''Skipped ' + @fullTable + '.' + @column + ' - '' + ERROR_MESSAGE(); END CATCH; '; EXEC sp_executesql @sql; END FETCH NEXT FROM column_cursor INTO @schema, @table, @column; END; CLOSE column_cursor; DEALLOCATE column_cursor;
description:
Searches all character-based columns across all tables and views for a specific keyword.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

--------------------- Define the search term--------------------------
DECLARE @searchTerm NVARCHAR(100) = 'Gift Aid';


--This is the only part of the script you need to change.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
--Searches all text-based columns in all tables/views for a keyword
--Skips invalid or inaccessible objects
--Shows matching table name, column name, and data
----------------------------------------------------------------------

DECLARE @schema NVARCHAR(128);
DECLARE @table NVARCHAR(128);
DECLARE @column NVARCHAR(128);
DECLARE @fullTable NVARCHAR(256);
DECLARE @sql NVARCHAR(MAX);

-- Cursor for text-based columns
DECLARE column_cursor CURSOR FOR
SELECT 
    TABLE_SCHEMA,
    TABLE_NAME,
    COLUMN_NAME
FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS
WHERE 
    DATA_TYPE IN ('varchar', 'nvarchar', 'char', 'nchar', 'text', 'ntext');

OPEN column_cursor;
FETCH NEXT FROM column_cursor INTO @schema, @table, @column;

WHILE @@FETCH_STATUS = 0
BEGIN
    SET @fullTable = QUOTENAME(@schema) + '.' + QUOTENAME(@table);

    -- Only proceed if the table exists
    IF EXISTS (
        SELECT 1 
        FROM sys.objects o
        JOIN sys.schemas s ON o.schema_id = s.schema_id
        WHERE o.name = @table AND s.name = @schema AND o.type IN ('U', 'V')  -- U = table, V = view
    )
    BEGIN
        SET @sql = '
BEGIN TRY
    IF EXISTS (
        SELECT 1 FROM ' + @fullTable + '
        WHERE ' + QUOTENAME(@column) + ' LIKE ''%' + @searchTerm + '%''
    )
    BEGIN
        PRINT ''Match in ' + @fullTable + '.' + @column + ''';
        SELECT 
            ''' + @fullTable + ''' AS TableName,
            ''' + @column + ''' AS ColumnName,
            * 
        FROM ' + @fullTable + '
        WHERE ' + QUOTENAME(@column) + ' LIKE ''%' + @searchTerm + '%'';
    END
END TRY
BEGIN CATCH
    PRINT ''Skipped ' + @fullTable + '.' + @column + ' - '' + ERROR_MESSAGE();
END CATCH;
';

        EXEC sp_executesql @sql;
    END

    FETCH NEXT FROM column_cursor INTO @schema, @table, @column;
END;

CLOSE column_cursor;
DEALLOCATE column_cursor;
